channel.title: CPHC Central North Pacific
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Central North Pacific

item.title: Central North Pacific Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
000
ACPN50 PHFO 270500
TWOCP

Tropical Weather Outlook
NWS Central Pacific Hurricane Center Honolulu HI
800 PM HST Mon Aug 26 2024

For the central North Pacific...between 140W and 180W:

Active Systems:
The Central Pacific Hurricane Center in Honolulu, Hawaii is issuing
advisories on Tropical Storm Hone. This system is located about 290
miles southwest of Lihue, Hawaii, moving west-northwest at 13 mph.

The National Hurricane Center in Miami, Florida is issuing
advisories on Hurricane Gilma, located about 1100 miles east of
Hilo, Hawaii. Gilma is forecast to continue westward into the
Central Pacific Hurricane Center's area of responsibility early
Tuesday.

The National Hurricane Center in Miami, Florida is also issuing
advisories on Tropical Storm Hector, located about 1900 miles east
of Hilo, Hawaii. Hector is expected to move into the Central
Pacific Hurricane Center's area of responsibility Thursday night
into Friday.

Elsewhere, no tropical cyclones are expected during the next 7 days.

&&

Public advisories on Tropical Storm Hone are issued under WMO
header WTPA31 PHFO and under AWIPS header HFOTCPCP1. Forecast
advisories on Tropical Storm Hone are issued under WMO header
WTPA11 PHFO and under AWIPS header HFOTCMCP1.

Public advisories on Hurricane Gilma are issued under WMO
header WTPZ32 KNHC and under AWIPS header MIATCPEP2. Forecast
advisories on Hurricane Gilma are issued under WMO header
WTPZ22 KNHC and under AWIPS header MIATCMEP2.

Public advisories on Tropical Storm Hector are issued under WMO
header WTPZ33 KNHC and under AWIPS header MIATCPEP3. Forecast
advisories on Tropical Storm Hector are issued under WMO header
WTPZ23 KNHC and under AWIPS header MIATCMEP3.

$$
Forecaster Gibbs
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Summary for Tropical Storm Hone (CP1/CP012024)
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
item.description: ...HONE CONTINUES WESTWARD AWAY FROM HAWAII... As of 11:00 PM HST Mon Aug 26 the center of Hone was located near 19.8, -164.3 with movement W at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1000 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 60 mph.

item.title: Tropical Storm Hone Public Advisory Number 20
item.description:
Issued at 1100 PM HST Mon Aug 26 2024 

804 
WTPA31 PHFO 270850
TCPCP1
 
BULLETIN
Tropical Storm Hone Advisory Number  20
NWS Central Pacific Hurricane Center Honolulu HI   CP012024
Issued by NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL
1100 PM HST Mon Aug 26 2024
 
...HONE CONTINUES WESTWARD AWAY FROM HAWAII...
 
 
SUMMARY OF 1100 PM HST...0900 UTC...INFORMATION
-----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...19.8N 164.3W
ABOUT 425 MI...685 KM WSW OF HONOLULU HAWAII
ABOUT 350 MI...565 KM WSW OF LIHUE HAWAII
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...60 MPH...95 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 280 DEGREES AT 14 MPH...22 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1000 MB...29.53 INCHES
 
 
WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
 
 
DISCUSSION AND OUTLOOK
----------------------
At 1100 PM HST (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Hone was 
located near latitude 19.8 North, longitude 164.3 West. Hone is 
moving toward the west near 14 mph (22 km/h) and this motion is 
expected to continue for the next few days. On the forecast track, 
Hone will continue moving away from the main Hawaiian Islands, and 
pass well north of Johnston Island Tuesday night.
 
Maximum sustained winds are near 60 mph (95 km/h) with higher gusts. 
Only gradual weakening is expected the next couple of days. Hone is 
expected to become a post-tropical low on Thursday, then dissipate 
on Friday.
 
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 80 miles (130 km)
from the center.
 
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1000 mb (29.53 inches).
 
 
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None.
 
 
NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 500 AM HST.
 
$$
Forecaster Kelly
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm Hone Forecast Advisory Number 20
item.description:
Issued at 0900 UTC TUE AUG 27 2024 

000
WTPA21 PHFO 270850
TCMCP1
 
TROPICAL STORM HONE FORECAST/ADVISORY NUMBER  20
NWS CENTRAL PACIFIC HURRICANE CENTER HONOLULU HI   CP012024
ISSUED BY NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
0900 UTC TUE AUG 27 2024
 
TROPICAL STORM CENTER LOCATED NEAR 19.8N 164.3W AT 27/0900Z
POSITION ACCURATE WITHIN  15 NM
 
PRESENT MOVEMENT TOWARD THE WEST OR 280 DEGREES AT  12 KT
 
ESTIMATED MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE 1000 MB
MAX SUSTAINED WINDS  50 KT WITH GUSTS TO  60 KT.
50 KT....... 20NE  10SE   0SW  20NW.
34 KT....... 70NE  50SE   0SW  70NW.
12 FT SEAS..170NE  60SE  80SW 170NW.
WINDS AND SEAS VARY GREATLY IN EACH QUADRANT.  RADII IN NAUTICAL
MILES ARE THE LARGEST RADII EXPECTED ANYWHERE IN THAT QUADRANT.
 
REPEAT...CENTER LOCATED NEAR 19.8N 164.3W AT 27/0900Z
AT 27/0600Z CENTER WAS LOCATED NEAR 19.7N 163.6W
 
FORECAST VALID 27/1800Z 20.0N 166.1W
MAX WIND  45 KT...GUSTS  55 KT.
34 KT... 70NE  50SE   0SW  70NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 28/0600Z 20.3N 168.1W
MAX WIND  45 KT...GUSTS  55 KT.
34 KT... 70NE  50SE   0SW  70NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 28/1800Z 20.1N 170.2W
MAX WIND  40 KT...GUSTS  50 KT.
34 KT... 60NE  30SE   0SW  60NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 29/0600Z 21.2N 172.2W
MAX WIND  35 KT...GUSTS  45 KT.
34 KT... 60NE  10SE   0SW  60NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 29/1800Z 21.7N 174.0W...POST-TROP/REMNT LOW
MAX WIND  35 KT...GUSTS  45 KT.
34 KT... 60NE   0SE   0SW  60NW.
 
FORECAST VALID 30/0600Z 22.0N 175.5W...POST-TROP/REMNT LOW
MAX WIND  30 KT...GUSTS  40 KT.
 
EXTENDED OUTLOOK. NOTE...ERRORS FOR TRACK HAVE AVERAGED NEAR 150 NM
ON DAY 4 AND 200 NM ON DAY 5...AND FOR INTENSITY NEAR 20 KT EACH DAY
 
OUTLOOK VALID 31/0600Z...DISSIPATED
 
REQUEST FOR 3 HOURLY SHIP REPORTS WITHIN 300 MILES OF 19.8N 164.3W
 
NEXT ADVISORY AT 27/1500Z
 
$$
FORECASTER KELLY
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm Hone Forecast Discussion Number 20
item.description:
Issued at 1100 PM HST Mon Aug 26 2024 

000
WTPA41 PHFO 270851
TCDCP1
 
Tropical Storm Hone Discussion Number  20
NWS Central Pacific Hurricane Center Honolulu HI   CP012024
Issued by NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL
1100 PM HST Mon Aug 26 2024
 
Deep convection continues to develop over the low-level circulation 
center of Tropical Storm Hone this evening. The latest subjective 
Dvorak intensity estimates came in at 3.0 from PHFO and JTWC, and at 
2.0 from SAB. Meanwhile, a couple of SATCON estimates from UW-CIMSS 
were around 50 knots close to 00z this afternoon. With little change 
in satellite presentation since the previous advisory package, the 
initial intensity has been held at 50 knots.

The initial motion estimate is 280/12 kt. Hone will continue 
slightly north of due west at a similar forward speed during the 
next 24 hours, steered by a subtropical ridge to the 
north-northeast. A similar motion with a slightly slower forward 
speed is expected thereafter, as the subtropical ridge weakens. The 
latest track forecast is similar to the previous advisory and 
closely follows the track consensus guidance.

Hone will remain in a rather hostile environment during the next few 
days with westerly vertical wind shear of 30 to 40 knots and dry 
mid-level air surrounding the system. Despite increasingly warm sea 
surface temperatures, the hostile conditions should lead to steady 
weakening during the next few days, and Hone is expected to become a 
post-tropical remnant low Thursday.  The intensity forecast has 
changed little and is closely aligned with the latest consensus 
guidance.
 
 
FORECAST POSITIONS AND MAX WINDS
 
INIT  27/0900Z 19.8N 164.3W   50 KT  60 MPH
 12H  27/1800Z 20.0N 166.1W   45 KT  50 MPH
 24H  28/0600Z 20.3N 168.1W   45 KT  50 MPH
 36H  28/1800Z 20.1N 170.2W   40 KT  45 MPH
 48H  29/0600Z 21.2N 172.2W   35 KT  40 MPH
 60H  29/1800Z 21.7N 174.0W   35 KT  40 MPH...POST-TROP/REMNT LOW
 72H  30/0600Z 22.0N 175.5W   30 KT  35 MPH...POST-TROP/REMNT LOW
 96H  31/0600Z...DISSIPATED
 
$$
Forecaster Kelly
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Tropical Storm Hone Wind Speed Probabilities Number 20
item.description:
Issued at 0900 UTC TUE AUG 27 2024 

000
FOPA11 PHFO 270851
PWSCP1
                                                                    
TROPICAL STORM HONE WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES NUMBER  20             
NWS CENTRAL PACIFIC HURRICANE CENTER HONOLULU HI   CP012024         
ISSUED BY NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL                    
0900 UTC TUE AUG 27 2024                                            
                                                                    
AT 0900Z THE CENTER OF TROPICAL STORM HONE WAS LOCATED NEAR LATITUDE
19.8 NORTH...LONGITUDE 164.3 WEST WITH MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS NEAR 
50 KTS...60 MPH...95 KM/H.                                          
                                                                    
Z INDICATES COORDINATED UNIVERSAL TIME (GREENWICH)                  
   PACIFIC  DAYLIGHT TIME (PDT)...SUBTRACT 7 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
   HAWAIIAN STANDARD TIME (HST)...SUBTRACT 10 HOURS FROM Z TIME     
                                                                    
WIND SPEED PROBABILITY TABLE FOR SPECIFIC LOCATIONS                 
                                                                    
CHANCES OF SUSTAINED (1-MINUTE AVERAGE) WIND SPEEDS OF AT LEAST     
   ...34 KT (39 MPH... 63 KM/H)...                                  
   ...50 KT (58 MPH... 93 KM/H)...                                  
   ...64 KT (74 MPH...119 KM/H)...                                  
FOR LOCATIONS AND TIME PERIODS DURING THE NEXT 5 DAYS               
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES FOR LOCATIONS ARE GIVEN AS OP(CP) WHERE               
    OP  IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT BEGINNING DURING            
        AN INDIVIDUAL TIME PERIOD (ONSET PROBABILITY)               
   (CP) IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT OCCURRING BETWEEN           
        06Z TUE AND THE FORECAST HOUR (CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY)      
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES ARE GIVEN IN PERCENT                                  
X INDICATES PROBABILITIES LESS THAN 1 PERCENT                       
PROBABILITIES FOR 34 KT AND 50 KT ARE SHOWN AT A GIVEN LOCATION WHEN
THE 5-DAY CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 3 PERCENT.             
PROBABILITIES FOR 34...50...64 KT SHOWN WHEN THE 5-DAY              
64-KT CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 1 PERCENT.                 
                                                                    
                                                                    
  - - - - WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES FOR SELECTED LOCATIONS - - - -

PERIODS         TO      TO      TO      TO      TO      TO      TO
